== Welcome ==

This is the home page for the '''Official Australian Ubuntu Local Community Team'''.  We also exist on <nowiki>[[https://launchpad.net/people/ubuntu-au|Launchpad]]</nowiki>.

=== Overview ===

The Australian team focuses on distributing, advertising and demonstrating Ubuntu within Australia. Through the development of our projects we focus on the areas of schools, business and home users.

== People ==

=== Team Contact ===

If you wish to find out further information regarding the Australian Team, its projects and membership information, the current contact for the group is YukiCuss.

=== Communication ===

We have two major places to communicate:
 1. #ubuntu, #ubuntu-au on irc.freenode.net:6667 <nowiki>[[http://meldra.no-ip.info/eucalyptirc|Via Shoutbox in your browser]]</nowiki>
 2. ubuntu-au@lists.ubuntu.com; to subscribe, see https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/ubuntu-au.

==== Meetings ====
The Australian Team meets fortnightly on Mondays.  The next scheduled meeting is at <nowiki>[[http://timeanddate.com/worldclock/fixedtime.html?month=7&day=11&year=2006&hour=10&min=0&sec=0&p1=0|24 July 2006, 1000UTC]]</nowiki> in #ubuntu-au. For the agendas for the next and previous meetings, as well as logs of previous meetings, please see <nowiki>[[AustralianTeam/Meetings]]</nowiki>.

==== IRC Operators ====
The current operators on the <code>#ubuntu-au</code> irc channel are: Yukicuss | Fujitsu | Kamping_Kaiser | Elkbuntu | Siccness

=== Members ===

The list of members is on the <nowiki>[[AustralianTeam/Members|Members page]]</nowiki>. 

You can also see our Frappr! Group Map at http://www.frappr.com/UbuntuAustralianTeam . A current list of user group affiliations can also be found on the members page.

We have a flickr page (photo resource) for Ubuntu Australia at http://www.flickr.com/groups/ubuntuau/. Please post all pictures from all Ubuntu Australia related events.

If you're an Aussie user of Ubuntu and you want to join the AustralianTeam, feel free to add yourself to the map and member list. A preliminary guide for new members or those interested in joining can be found on the <nowiki>[[AustralianTeam/Members/NewMembers|New Members]]</nowiki> page.

== Projects ==

The Ubuntu Australian Team is currently developing a few key projects to help promote and raise awareness of Ubuntu in Australia.

Key projects that are currently being developed include:
* Ubuntu-In-Homes
* Ubuntu-In-Schools
* Ubuntu-In-Business
* Ubuntu-In-Not-for-Profit

<nowiki>[[AustralianTeam/Projects/UbuntuFriendlyNotebooks|Ubuntu Friendly Notebooks]]</nowiki> - a guide to purchasing Ubuntu Friendly Notebooks in Australia.

For further information on these projects please see the <nowiki>[[AustralianTeam/Projects|Projects page]]</nowiki>.

=== Talks ===

* NaamanCampbell: UbuntuOnSunRay presentation - <nowiki>[[attachment:Presentations/ubuntuonsunray.odp]]</nowiki> - presented at <nowiki>[[http://www.humbug.org.au|HUMBUG]]</nowiki> to promote the use of Ubuntu on SunRay thin-clients, more info in <nowiki>[[http://greenmidgetcafe.blogspot.com/2006/03/odp-open-source-demonstration.html|blog]]</nowiki>.

=== Logo ===

The current ubuntu-au logo was decided upon at the <nowiki>[[AustralianTeam/Meetings/2006Apr04|April 4 meeting]]</nowiki>. Designs, submissions and thoughts for the logo can be viewed on <nowiki>[[AustralianTeam:Logo|the Logo page]]</nowiki>. Logo #7 was chosen as the official Ubuntu-au logo.

=== Local CD distribution ===

APC Magazine (August edition) has Ubuntu 6.06 LTS on its DVD-ROM \o/ .

It works exactly like the Dapper Desktop CD - Live Environment with GUI
installer. A DVD reader is required though (of course).

=== Customising Ubuntu ===

Our <nowiki>[[http://help.ubuntu.com/community/LocalCustomisation/Australia|Customisation]]</nowiki> page describes ways to customise Ubuntu for Australian conditions. Also see our local apt mirrors page - <nowiki>[[/LocalAptMirrors|LocalAptMirrors]]</nowiki>
